revised_title: The Variability of Temperature in the British Isles (1869-1883)
tldr: This article investigates the variability of temperature in the British Isles from 1869 to 1883, analyzing daily mean temperatures at seven observatories. The results show that the mean annual difference is greatest at Kew, with annual ranges reaching a maximum in December and a minimum in August. The study also reveals that sudden temperature rises are more frequent and of greater magnitude than sudden falls in these islands.
